t: And*p when any will offer a grain offering unto the Lord,*s his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

And*p he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, to be an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord:*s
And*p the remnant of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire.
And*p if thou bring an oblation of a grain offering baken in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
And*p if thy oblation be a grain offering baken in a pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
Thou*p shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it is a grain offering.
And*p if thy oblation be a grain offering baken in the fryingpan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
And*p thou shalt bring the grain offering that is made of these things unto the Lord:*s and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall bring it unto the altar.
And*p the priest shall take from the grain offering a memorial thereof, and shall burn it upon the altar: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.*s
And*p that which is left of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the Lord*s made by fire.
No*p grain offering, which ye shall bring unto the Lord,*s shall be made with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, in any offering of the Lord*s made by fire.
As*p for the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the Lord:*s but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

And*p every oblation of thy grain offering shalt thou season with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy grain offering: with all thine offerings thou shalt offer salt.

And*p if thou offer a grain offering of thy firstfruits unto the Lord,*s thou shalt offer for the grain offering of thy firstfruits green ears of corn dried by the fire, even corn beaten out of full ears.
And*p thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon: it is a grain offering.
And*p the priest shall burn the memorial of it, part of the beaten corn thereof, and part of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof: it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.*s
